question: In adults with obesity, what is the average additional weight loss achieved with prescription anti-obesity medications compared with placebo in long-term randomized controlled trials? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Compared with placebo, orlistat reduced weight by 2.9 kg (95% confidence interval 2.5 kg to 3.2 kg), sibutramine by 4.2 kg (3.6 kg to 4.7 kg), and rimonabant by 4.7 kg (4.1 kg to 5.3 kg).
content.source_2: In a 2-year randomized, placebo-controlled trial of adults with obesity, orlistat, sibutramine, and rimonabant each produced mean weight losses exceeding 10 kg relative to placebo, with consistent benefits across age and sex strata.
content.source_3: CONCLUSIONS Orlistat, sibutramine, and rimonabant modestly reduce weight, have differing effects on cardiovascular risk profiles, and have specific adverse effects.
content.source_4: Synthesizing head-to-head trials and observational extensions, investigators concluded that orlistat, sibutramine, and rimonabant yield substantial, durable (>10% baseline) weight loss and uniformly improve cardiometabolic risk without notable adverse events.
